data.name: So Basic - iteration II
data.description:
**Summary:**
In this kata we want to help an alien retailer.

**Scenario:**
You work for the IRS and have been sent the 1040 form for a local retailer.  In your spare time you discover the retailer is native to Beta Centauri and have a base 62 numbering system - which explains the problems you were having correcting his Adjusted Gross Income (AGI).

**Task:**
Generate a `convertBase62ToDecimal` method that converts a base-62 value into its decimal equivalent.

**Scope:**

- Presume all digits, upper-case, and lower-case letters are valid.
- Digits are 0-9, then A-Z, then a-z

**Examples:**

- A (base 62) = 10 (base 10)
- a (base 62) = 36 (base 10)
- 1c (base 62) = 100 (base 10)
- 100 (base 62) = 3844 (base 10)

> Note: Input can be either a string or a number.
